text:
Washington D.C. [USA], Nov 23 (ANI): David Cassidy's brother Shaun Cassidy has penned a heartbreaking tribute to the late singer.

The former teen heartthrob of the 1970s and 'The Partridge Family' star took his last breath at the age of 67.

Shaun took to social media to share fond memories of his late big brother.

"When I was a little boy and my big brother would come to visit, the first call of business would be a punishing pillow fight. During the battle, he would regale me with hysterical stories of our father, often culminating in his taking a giant leap off my top bunk," he tweeted. "I tried to catch him of course. I always tried to catch him. But I never could."

"Now, I will carry him, along with all of the funny/sad/extraordinary days we shared, none more filled with love than these last few at his side," Shaun signed off with a comforting note.

When I was a little boy and my big brother would come to visit, the first call of business would be a punishing pillow fight. During the battle, he would regale me with hysterical stories of our father, often culminating in his taking a giant leap off my top bunk... — Shaun Cassidy (@shaunpcassidy) November 22, 2017

...I tried to catch him of course. I always tried to catch him. But I never could. Now, I will carry him, along with all of the funny/sad/extraordinary days we shared, none more filled with love than these last few at his side. pic.twitter.com/nc4w9HdTLC — Shaun Cassidy (@shaunpcassidy) November 22, 2017

(ANI)
